com.joliciel.talismane.tokeniser.filters

Class AbstractRegexFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.joliciel.talismane.tokeniser.filters.AbstractRegexFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NeedsTalismaneSession, TokenFilter, TokenRegexFilter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AttributeRegexFilter, TokenRegexFilterImpl

    public abstract class AbstractRegexFilter
extends Object
implements TokenRegexFilter, NeedsTalismaneSession
    A parent class for TokenRegexFilter implementations, which knows how to construct the Pattern using the various attributes set and the initial regex, and how to apply the regex to get the matching placeholders.
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

      boolean isAutoWordBoundaries()
      If true, will automatically add a word boundary at the beginning and end of the regex, as long as the regex begins/ends with a letter (inside round or square brackets or not), or one of the character classes \d, \w, or \p{WordList|Lower|Upper|Alpha|Digit|ASCII}.
      boolean isCaseSensitive()
      If false, will replace any letter by a class containing the uppercase and lowercase versions of the letter.
      boolean isDiacriticSensitive()
      If false, will replace any adorned letter with a class containing both unadorned and adorned versions.
      boolean isExcluded()
      Returns true if this TokenFilter should be excluded from the list of TokenFilters for the current configuration.
      boolean isPossibleSentenceBoundary()
      Can this regex represent a sentence boundary (at its last character that is)?

        public int getGroupIndex()

        If provided, indicates the group index to tokenise (and possibly replace). Useful for identifying tokens by their context. Default is 0, meaning the entire regex is tokenised and replaced.

      • isDiacriticSensitive

        public boolean isDiacriticSensitive()
        Description copied from interface: TokenRegexFilter
        If false, will replace any adorned letter with a class containing both unadorned and adorned versions. Default is true.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:

      • isCaseSensitive

        public boolean isCaseSensitive()
        Description copied from interface: TokenRegexFilter
        If false, will replace any letter by a class containing the uppercase and lowercase versions of the letter. If the letter has a diacritic, both the unadorned and adorned uppercase versions will be included. Default is true.
        Specified by:
        isCaseSensitive in interface TokenRegexFilter

      • setCaseSensitive

        public void setCaseSensitive(boolean caseSensitive)
        Specified by:
        setCaseSensitive in interface TokenRegexFilter

      • isAutoWordBoundaries

        public boolean isAutoWordBoundaries()
        Description copied from interface: TokenRegexFilter
        If true, will automatically add a word boundary at the beginning and end of the regex, as long as the regex begins/ends with a letter (inside round or square brackets or not), or one of the character classes \d, \w, or \p{WordList|Lower|Upper|Alpha|Digit|ASCII}. Note that a + at the end of the regex is ignored, but a * or ? is not (as it doesn't guarantee that the class will be matched). Default is false.
        Specified by:
        isAutoWordBoundaries in interface TokenRegexFilter

      • setAutoWordBoundaries

        public void setAutoWordBoundaries(boolean autoWordBoundaries)
        Specified by:
        setAutoWordBoundaries in interface TokenRegexFilter

          throws TokenFilterLoadException
        Description copied from interface: TokenFilter
        Load the token filter's state using information extracted from a descriptor.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        parameters - a series of name/value parameters
        tabs - a list of unnamed parameters, whose placement determines their meaning

      • loadInternal

        protected abstract void loadInternal(Map<String,String> parameters,
                                     List<String> tabs)
                              throws TokenFilterLoadException
        Load the token filter's state using information extracted from a descriptor.
        Parameters:
        parameters - a series of name/value parameters. Subclasses should remove any parameters handled before passing on to the superclass.
        tabs - a list of unnamed parameters, whose placement determines their meaning
        Throws:
        TokenFilterLoadException
